Question: This person responded with the Embargo Act of 1807, directed also at Great Britain.
Hints: Though France was at the brink of revolution, this person's tenure there was generally an uneventful one.
This person, however, continued to idealize the yeoman farmer as the base for republican government.
This person moved into the South Pavilion (an outbuilding) in 1770, where his new wife, Martha, joined him in 1772.
